result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan nmi Garibay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 86 days, if revoked.
No restitution  requested
Deft accepted into the Drug Court Program and to report to Drug Court every Wed at 3:30pm.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not have contact with co-deft or WalMart Store, unless otherwise permitted by the court.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Deft accepted tinto Drug Court and to report to Drug Court every Wednesday at 3:30pm.

supervisions.notes:
Probation Revoked.
To run concurrent to 14CF1387.
Any unpaid court obligations are still to be collected.

MINUTES:  10:30 am-  Victim rights compliance.  Def. sentenced to:
Cts 1 & 2:
ITC:  2 years
ES:   2 years
TLS:  4 years, concurrent.
300 days sentence credit given.  To run concurrent to 14CF1387.  Conditions of extended supervision given.  Court costs ordered. Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.  Appeal rights given.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge - Cts 1 & 2

Defendant Juan nmi Garibay appeared with Attorney Lara Parker.  Defendant in custody.  Attorney Jennifer Ann Phan appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: JM.
MINUTES:  Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 1-Fel Retail Theft-Intent-PTAC, Repeater & Ct 2-Fel BJ, Repeater; found guilty by the court.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.  PSI report waived.
Cts 1 & 2:  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 36 months w/conditions.  86 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court costs ordered.  No restitution requested.  Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.  Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.  Appeal rights given.  Def. accepted into the Drug Court Program and to report to Drug Court every Wed. at 3:30pm.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Lara Parker.  Clerk: PT
Atty Parkers states DE has been accepted into drug court so cases will be resolved through drug court on 4/1/15 at 3:30 PM.
Plea & Sentencing hrg set for 4/1/15 at 3:30 pm before Drug Court at the request of Atty Parker & ADA Braun.
Scheduling Order

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Lara Parker. Clerk LE. Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 3-13-15 @ 8:30am with co-def. in 15CF17. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing
Lara Parker

145 p.m.  Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards. Clk  LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 1/23/15 @ 945 a.m.   $500 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).
